intro: Parapentace brilletii, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a small, deciduous shrub native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and opposite, simple leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has some traditional medicinal uses. However, it is important to note that it can be toxic if ingested.
